input_text: LU Factuality: Choosing the Location
LU Factuality: Choosing mountainous locations, preferably 1-3 hours from main cities, which have water resources.
LU Factuality: Being close to cities is important in order to have important services.
LU Factuality: If a mountainous location is unviable, then choose a location next to official Buidings so as to avoid being bombarded.
LU Factuality: Again, if the above is not possible, then choose a location next to residential areas, for the same reason as above.
LU Factuality: The location should be away from airports and main highways.
LU Factuality: It is preferable it has its own private access in order to protect it and control it better.
LU Factuality: Protection Methods
LU Factuality: Outside Protection:
LU Factuality: Human protection
LU Factuality: - Patrols close to locations
LU Factuality: - Patrols distant from the location.
LU Factuality: Animal protection:
LU Factuality: Electronic protection:
LU Factuality: Permanent Protection:
LU Factuality: They are erected according to the nature of the location.
LU Factuality: They can take one of the following forms:
LU Factuality: Insert 4 inch pipes in the ground at 50 centimeters apart and a height of one meter then fill them with cement.
LU Factuality: They are filled with cement and place around the building, especially at the entrance to prevent cars from crashing into it.
LU Factuality: They are better than road bumps because they are harder to see.
LU Factuality: The ditch should be 30 centimeters deep and 20 centimeters wide.
LU Factuality: Passage ways for cars and pedestrians should be designated.
LU Factuality: Road bumps: Six successive bumps should be constructed at 500 meters from the location.

LU Factuality: The distance between the first and fourth bump should be 100 meters, and the distance between the fourth and the sixth should be 50 meters, so cars cannot travel fast in the direction of the building.
LU Factuality: Barbed Wires: They should be placed around the building, around the walls, or on top of the walls.
LU Factuality: These are placed at the main gate in order to puncture the tires of any car crashing in.
LU Factuality: Fences are the best form of permanent protection.
LU Factuality: It shields off all activities which take place inside the location.
LU Factuality: The following should be considered when erecting fences:
LU Factuality: The fence which is built out of bricks or concrete should be 4 meters high, then topped with one meter high barbed wire fence.
LU Factuality: It is preferable that the barbed wires slant outwards at a 70 degrees angle.
LU Factuality: The thickness of the fence should be 60 cm and the distance between it and the building should be 2 meters.
LU Factuality: Secret gates should be built 50 meters apart to be used for emergency only.
LU Factuality: However, they should not be identifiable from the outside part of the fence.
LU Factuality: It is preferable that any location has only 2 emergency gates and far away from one another.
LU Factuality: No other outside gates should be erected.
LU Factuality: If it is necessary to have an outside entrance for the control tower, then access to the location should not be constructed.
LU Factuality: If the location is in a highly dangerous zone, then two parallel fences should be built to be 3 meters apart.
LU Factuality: The space between the two fences could be mined in order to prevent infiltration.
LU Factuality: It is preferable the fence be square or rectangular in shape.
LU Factuality: A circular shaped fence is harder to protect because of hidden angles.
LU Factuality: Parking areas are of importance because most sabotage operations are done with cars.
LU Factuality: Therefore, it is important to adopt following:
LU Factuality: The parking lot should be 50 meters away from the fence.
LU Factuality: If the nature of the terrain does not allow it, then it should be on the other side of the road.
LU Factuality: Under no circumstance a car, even that which belongs to the location should be permitted to park next to the fence.
LU Factuality: Assign a parking spot for visitors which would not make them feel insulted.
LU Factuality: Usually such parking spots are on the side of the lot.
LU Factuality: Inside parking lot should be strictly designated to the location's cars in order to protect them from sabotage.
LU Factuality: Also, the visitors with high security clearance should be designated parking spots inside the location.
LU Factuality: Cars parked inside the location should have their front facing the fence so they could be used quickly in case of emergency.
target_text: (could, certain); (should, certain); (facing, certain); (parked, certain); (used, unknown); (have, unknown)

input_text: LU Factuality: All parking regulations of the location should be followed strictly followed.
LU Factuality: Some buses should be exposed and others should be camouflaged.
LU Factuality: The buses should have the following:
LU Factuality: Wireless equipment to report dangerous activities
LU Factuality: Writing materials to jot down suspicious activities or license plate numbers.
LU Factuality: Sand bags arounf the busses to protect them from gun fire.
LU Factuality: These are camouflaged to look like commercial companies' vehicles or traveling salesmen's vehicles.
LU Factuality: They are entrusted with the task of tracking down the movement of strangers who are approaching the location.

LU Factuality: The objective of having kiosks is they serve as communication points between the guards and the visitors or those who are approaching the building and deal with them according to their requirements.
target_text: (objective, certain); (having, certain); (is, certain); (serve, certain); (points, certain); (approaching, certain); (deal, certain); (according, certain); (requirements, certain)

input_text: LU Factuality: Kiosks should be placed at entrance gates to check visitors when approaching the building.
LU Factuality: Kiosks should be placed at key important locations where24 hour security watch is required.
LU Factuality: The Kiosk should be designed to stand all weather conditions, and provide a full coverage of the area it is placed at.
target_text: (placed, certain); (should, certain); (coverage, certain); (stand, unknown); (provide, unknown); (designed, unknown)

input_text: LU Factuality: The Kiosk should be equipped with wireless communication equipment, and a mechanist to open and close the gate automatically.
LU Factuality: Direct the visitors' cars to special parking spots, away from the fence and the control tower.
LU Factuality: The following should be observed:
LU Factuality: The lower part of the tower should serve as a shelter for the guards, when needed.
LU Factuality: Going up the tower should be from inside.
LU Factuality: The towers should be located in a manner where they can easily communicate with one another, and totally cover the area they are guarding.
LU Factuality: They should have telescopes in order to constantly control the areas around them.
LU Factuality: Entrances to the towers should be totally camouflaged.
LU Factuality: They should have a protruding area to better control their surroundings.
LU Factuality: Outside Patrols
LU Factuality: The locality cannot be fully protected without having patrols roaming on the outside area of the fence.

LU Factuality: The above mentioned protection procedures are only for observation purposes, while patrols check the fences, the barriers, and the towers, and submit periodic reports on their findings.
target_text: (reports, certain); (findings, certain); (check, certain); (submit, certain); (procedures, certain); (are, certain)

input_text: LU Factuality: It also checks on guard posts.
LU Factuality: They also engage with persons approaching the locality and support the guards in their duties.
LU Factuality: They also provide extra fire power in when guards or other patrols are engaged in a gun battle.
LU Factuality: These patrols are formed as follows:
LU Factuality: Single patrols which consist of two people checking the outside area of the location.
LU Factuality: Common patrols which consist of one man and a dog, also checking the outside area of the location.
LU Factuality: These patrols tour the area during specific times such as, dinner, dawn, dusk, and midnight.
LU Factuality: The patrol should be armed with light weapon such as Kalashnikovs and RPGs, and cover the area on foot.
LU Factuality: Area Patrols

LU Factuality: These patrols comb the greater area surrounding the location periodically; anywhere between 3 and four times a week The patrol should be lead by a security officer in order to take immediate actions if the need arises.
LU Factuality: Also, the duty of area patrols is to discover new paths and shelters in the area in order to hide fighters after a Jihad operation against the enemy.
LU Factuality: The area patrol is different from the single patrol in that:
LU Factuality: It has a vehicle equipped with a machine gun.
LU Factuality: It can use horses to canvass the area, but the patrol should be formed of 2 or 3 people at least.
LU Factuality: Internal Protection
LU Factuality: This kind of protection should be done without drawing attention so that people inside the location would feel at ease.
target_text: (protection, certain); (should, certain); (drawing, certain); (would, certain); (feel, unknown); (done, unknown)

input_text: LU Factuality: The purpose of the Covenant:
LU Factuality: There are two types of covenants:
LU Factuality: the religious lawful duty, and the permissible.
LU Factuality: The religious lawful duty, such as al-Jihad and the obedience to higher authorities, is every Muslim's duty by religious law.
LU Factuality: In such a case, allegiance means enforcing the religious lawful duty.
LU Factuality: Even without allegiance, it is still a lawful religious duty.
LU Factuality: While in the case of permissible matters, allegiance makes them religious lawful duties.
LU Factuality: He founded this case on the saying of the Mighty Allah, "If you promise, you have to fulfill your promise.  "
